meanings.sent1: She tried to repress her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: He tends to repress his emotions and rarely shows how he truly feels.
meanings.sent3: The urge to repress a giggle in a quiet library can be quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The dam was built to repress the flow of the river, controlling its power.
meanings.sent5: In order to repress the rising anger, she took a deep breath and counted to ten.

meanings.sent1: The dictator used force to repress any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent2: The medication helped to repress the symptoms of the illness.
meanings.sent3: Trying to repress a yawn in a boring class can be a real struggle.
meanings.sent4: The police worked to repress the criminal activity in the city.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to repress the urge to shout when the students wouldn't listen.

meanings.definition: To keep under control or in check
meanings.sent1: She had to repress the urge to eat the entire cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: It's important to repress your temper and think before reacting in anger.
meanings.sent3: He tried to repress his excitement about the surprise party, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The company had to repress their spending in order to stay within budget.
meanings.sent5: To repress the spread of rumors, the manager addressed the issue immediately.
